recipe_card: Southwestern Chicken Salad 15 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1  lemon, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  bay leaf"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ teaspoon dried thyme, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ teaspoon paprika"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup light mayonnaise"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup sour cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups fresh corn, cooked and cut from the cob"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup diced orange bell pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Fill a large skillet with 1 inch (2.5 cm) of water. Add lemon slices, bay leaf, peppercorns and 2/3 of the thyme, and bring to boiling over high heat. Add chicken, reduce heat to low and simmer for 15-18 minutes, turning chicken once, until juices run clear and chicken is no longer pink. Remove chicken from liquid and set aside to cool."},{"recipe_directions":"In a small skillet, stir together the paprika and remaining thyme over medium-low heat for 2 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together the toasted paprika mixture, mayonnaise, sour cream, salt, ground pepper and nutmeg until evenly blended."},{"recipe_directions":"Cube cooled chicken and transfer to a medium bowl. Add prepared dressing, corn, cilantro, orange pepper and jalapeno and toss until evenly coated. Serve warm, or refrigerate until ready to serve."}]

recipe_card: Tex-Mex Beef Bowl with Avocado Cilantro Dressing 7 Ratings

recipe_name: Tex-Mex Beef Bowl with Avocado Cilantro Dressing
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon garlic powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon chili powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon kosher salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon sweet paprika"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon ground cumin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ pound flank steak"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup cooked white rice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup halved cherry tomatoes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup chopped romaine lettuce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup tortilla chips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup canned black beans"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  jalapeno pepper, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  lime, cut into wedges"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup crumbled cotija cheese"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  avocados, peeled and pitted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup chopped fresh cilantro"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons sour cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  lime, juiced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 clove garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat until just barely smoking."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine garlic powder, chili powder, kosher salt, paprika, and cumin in a bowl; rub over all sides of flank steak."},{"recipe_directions":"Grill flank steak in the preheated grill pan, flipping halfway through, until browned and cooked to desired doneness, about 8 minutes. Let steak rest on a work surface for 10 minutes. Thinly slice steak against the grain."},{"recipe_directions":"Divide rice, tomatoes, romaine lettuce, tortilla chips, black beans, jalapeno peppers, and lime wedges between 2 serving bowls; top with steak, cotija cheese, and 1 tablespoon cilantro."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine avocados, water, 1/2 cup cilantro, sour cream, lime juice, garlic, and salt in a blender; blend until dressing is smooth. Pour dressing over each bowl."}]

recipe_card: Tajin® Fruit Salad
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 large  oranges, peeled and segmented"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  mango, diced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup diced fresh pineapple"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup diced jicama"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 small cucumber, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  banana, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  limes, juiced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon chile-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®), or more to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon chopped fresh mint, or to taste (Optional)"}]

Mexican Orzo Salad 57 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (16 ounce) package orzo pasta"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 small red bell pepper, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 small yellow bell pepper, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 bunch green onions, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 small red onion, finely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8.75 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup chopped cilantro leaves"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"pepper to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5  limes, juiced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 tablespoons canola oil"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a boil over high heat. Stir in the orzo, and return to a boil. Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the pasta has cooked through, but is still firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Drain."},{"recipe_directions":"Place the drained orzo in a large salad bowl, and fold in the red pepper, yellow pepper, green onions, red onion, chickpeas, kidney beans, black beans, corn, cilantro, and salt and pepper to taste. Pour the lime juice and oil over the salad, toss to coat, and refrigerate at least 2 hours to chill before serving."}]

Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; rinse under cold running water, and drain."},{"recipe_directions":"In a large bowl, combine the salsa, mayonnaise, green pepper, garlic powder, salt, black pepper, and olives; mix well. recipe_card: Beef Taco Salad 142 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound lean ground beef"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 head iceberg lettuce - rinsed, dried, and shredded"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  onion, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  green bell pepper, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cups shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese blend"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  tomatoes, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 ounces crushed tortilla chips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup French dressing, or as needed"}]

Add taco seasoning mix and prepare according to package directions. Set aside to cool."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine cooled beef mixture, lettuce, onion, bell pepper, cheese, tomatoes, and tortilla chips in a large serving bowl. Add enough dressing to coat; mix well and refrigerate for 8 hours to overnight."}]

recipe_card: Mexican Corn-off-the-Cob Salad 10 Ratings

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate."},{"recipe_directions":"Grill corn in the husks on the preheated grill, turning occasionally, to desired tenderness, about 15 minutes; some charring is fine. Remove from the grill. Remove and discard husks and silk when cool enough to handle. Cut kernels off into a medium bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Add lime juice and chili powder, then mix in cotija cheese, cilantro, mayonnaise, and pepper until thoroughly combined. Taste and add salt if necessary."}]

recipe_card: Barley Lime Fiesta Salad 50 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup pearl barley"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8.75 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 small red onion, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  green bell pepper, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  red bell pepper, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large carrot, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 stalk celery, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾  chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, finely chopped, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon canola oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon ground cumin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons light corn syrup, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon canola oil, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon lime juice, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon lemon juice, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon distilled white vinegar, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon onion powder, or to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Bring water and barley to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer until barley is tender, about 30 minutes. Remove from heat, drain if necessary, and chill barley in the refrigerator."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine cooled barley, corn, beans, onion, bell peppers, carrot, celery, chipotle pepper, oil, salt, black pepper, and cumin in a large salad bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Make vinaigrette: Whisk together water, cilantro, corn syrup, oil, lime juice, lemon juice, vinegar, and onion powder in a medium bowl. Pour vinaigrette over barley mixture and toss to combine. Refrigerate salad until thoroughly chilled."}]

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease 6 muffin cups."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix corn muffin mix, chile peppers, milk, and egg together until combined but still slightly lumpy. Fill the prepared muffin cups 2/3 full."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes. Let muffins cool for 15 minutes, then crumble into a bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Using 1/2 of each ingredient, make layers in a large glass bowl in the following order: muffin crumbs, pinto beans, salad dressing, bell pepper, corn, tomatoes, bacon bits, Cheddar cheese, and green onion. Repeat layers once more."},{"recipe_directions":"Cover and refrigerate until chilled, about 2 hours."}]

Cover bowl with a lid and refrigerate until flavors blend, at least 2 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir salad again before serving."}]

recipe_card: Mexican-Style Shrimp Cocktail 36 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup clam juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon dried oregano"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups peeled, seeded, diced ripe tomatoes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup diced English cucumber"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup diced celery"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup finely diced red onion"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons seeded and diced jalapeno peppers"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup ketchup"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 medium limes, juiced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons freshly chopped cilantro, plus more for garnish"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 dash Mexican-style hot sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large Hass avocado, cubed"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Bring clam juice and oregano to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add shrimp; cook and stir just until shrimp turn pink, about 2 minutes. (They will not be cooked through.) Transfer shrimp to a bowl with a slotted spoon; let cool to room temperature. Reserve liquid."},{"recipe_directions":"While the shrimp are cooling, combine tomatoes, cucumbers, celery, onion, and jalapeños in a mixing bowl. Gently mix in reserved cooking liquid, ketchup, lime juice, 2 tablespoons cilantro, and hot sauce until well combined."},{"recipe_directions":"Place four whole shrimp in a small bowl; cover with plastic wrap. Chop remaining shrimp into bite-sized pieces; add to vegetable mixture and stir to combine. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate both bowls until thoroughly chilled, 2 to 3 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"When ready to serve, stir avocado into the shrimp cocktail. Divide into four glass bowls; top each with a chilled whole shrimp and garnish with cilantro."}]

recipe_card: Easy Black Bean Taco Salad 15 Ratings

Cook beef mixture until thickened, about 10 more minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Place black beans into a saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Spread 1/4 of the beef mixture on a serving plate and top with 1/4 of the black beans; repeat with remaining beef mixture and beans to make 4 salads. Spread separate layers of romaine lettuce, salsa, tomatoes, and cheese over salads. Generously garnish with sour cream and tortilla chips."}]

recipe_card: Cilantro Tomato Corn Salad 169 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"3 ears fresh corn in husks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup butter, melted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ small red onion, finely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cloves garlic, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ bunch fresh cilantro, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt-free lemon-herb seasoning (such as Mrs. Dash)"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Peel back corn husks, but leave them attached at the bottom. Remove the silks, and fold husks back up over the corn. Place on a dinner plate, and cook in the microwave for 5 minutes on High power, turning corn once half way through. Cool until cool enough to touch, then slice corn kernels from the cob and place them in a serving bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir butter into the corn along with the tomatoes, jalapeno, red onion, garlic and cilantro. recipe_card: Chicken Fiesta Salad 699 Ratings

recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4 large ripe tomatoes, cut into bite-size pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 bunch cilantro, stems cut off and leaves coarsely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large green bell pepper, cut into bite-size pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large red bell pepper, cut into bite-size pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  jalapeno peppers, finely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  green onions, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  sweet red onion, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 large avocados, pitted and cut into bite-sized pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  lime, juiced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt, or to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"In a large salad bowl, lightly mix the tomatoes, cilantro, green and red bell peppers, jalapeno peppers, green onions, and sweet red onion until thoroughly combined. recipe_name: Pico de Gallo with Cabbage (Mexican Coleslaw)
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 head cabbage, shredded"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5  Roma (plum) tomatoes, diced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼  red onion, diced, or more to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup pickled jalapeno slices, diced and juice reserved"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"7 tablespoons lime juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons red wine vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon chili powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or more to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Combine cabbage, tomatoes, red onion, jalapeno slices, 2 tablespoons juice from jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, vinegar, chili powder, black pepper, salt, and cayenne pepper in a bowl; refrigerate for flavors to blend, 1 to 2 hours."}]

recipe_name: Taco Salad with Lime Vinegar Dressing
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound lean ground beef"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 head romaine lettuce, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (10 ounce) basket grape tomatoes, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  avocado, pitted and sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup chopped carrots, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup chopped green bell pepper, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup chopped celery, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup lime juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons honey"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons champagne vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons Dijon mustard"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cloves garlic, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt and ground black pepper to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease. Add water and taco seasoning mix; cook and stir until water is evaporated and beef is evenly coated in seasoning mix, about 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix romaine lettuce, kidney beans, tomatoes, avocado, carrots, green bell pepper, celery, and Cheddar cheese in a large bowl; top with ground beef."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk lime juice, honey, vinegar, cilantro, mustard, garlic, salt, and pepper together in a bowl until dressing is well mixed; served alongside salad."}]

recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6 ears corn in the husk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup mayonnaise"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  lime, juiced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon hot sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon mild chile powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon smoked paprika"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup crumbled Cotija cheese"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup coarsely chopped cilantro"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  scallions, sliced"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Soak corn in cold water for at least 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix mayonnaise, lime juice, hot sauce, chile powder, and paprika together in a bowl. Refrigerate chile-lime mayonnaise."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate. Drain corn and grill away from the heat source, 15 to 20 minutes. Let cool until easily handled. Shuck corn and return to the grill; cook over the heat source until lightly charred, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove and let cool."},{"recipe_directions":"Cut kernels off the cob. Combine corn kernels, Cotija cheese, cilantro, and scallions in a large bowl. Fold in chile-lime mayonnaise."}]
